name: Home of Elsa Morante and Alberto Moravia, via dell'Oca, 27
desc:
It was at this address that Pier Paolo Pasolini found close friends: the couple of writers Elsa Morante and Alberto Moravia, whom he met in 1955. These two figures of Italian intellectual life made their flat one of the city's cultural centres– a flat that they would inhabit up until their separation in 1962. Between them there grew up an unshakeable complicity, made up of ideological emulation, discussions about the state of Italian society, and openness to the world. Thus, the three of them would travel in Africa and India, and the report of those travels would give rise to the publication, a few years later, of The Smell of India.

When, one day, his father urged him to go to University, Bernardo Bertolucci responded with a definitive: 'My university is going to dine every evening at the home of Elsa Morante and Alberto Moravia with Pier Paolo Pasolini.'
